intro: Ardisia furva, commonly known as the red-berried evergreen, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers followed by bright red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Ardisia furva is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal fruit display. It thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments with moist, well-drained soil.
